title: Cheap but not super comfy
text:
The staff isn't the most welcoming (the two women were having their own convo while I was trying to check in), but if you need a cheap place to stay for the night (which I did, had to be able to work during Winter Storm Stella), this is your spot. The rooms are small but clean and have everything you might need: Hangers, shower, private bath (in some rooms, like mine), desk, and TV. The bed is very hard and is just a mattress in a wooden frame. I didn't sleep well (not just because the fire alarm went off at 4am by accident and couldn't fall asleep after), but it was easy to get to/from work during terrible weather. Restaurant inside is delicious but pricey. They were also closed for breakfast in the AM, which I didn't expect, so I got a (fantastic) croissant and (terrible) coffee in the bar area the next morning.
I also got a bit of pushback when checking out because I had booked my room on Travelocity (though the woman at the desk said I used Expedia). She said she couldn't give me an itemized bill because of it, a problem I have never had before. This expense report is now going to be a pain because they were apparently unhappy I used a third-party to book my room. That's a new one for me. I also mentioned that one of my lamps wasn't working and she nodded, but didn't appear to make any note of it. Just a heads up if you're staying in room 1504 and planning to read in bed!
If you're a tourist who will be exhausted by the end of the day and can sleep on very hard mattresses, you'll like it, but I don't think I'll pick this spot again.
